docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: As highlighted in ''What Are You Afraid Of? A Hidden Issue Emerges'' (Week in Review, June 4), politicians in both parties are vying to define themselves as committed to protecting Americans' privacy.
docs.abstract: Robert Jaffe letter says politicians in both parties are making an issue of privacy (June 4 article), but some, including George W Bush, fail to recognize the most profound privacy right of all: the right to decide whether and when to have a child
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    As highlighted in ''What Are You Afraid Of? A Hidden Issue Emerges'' (Week in Review, June 4), politicians in both parties are vying to define themselves as committed to protecting Americans' privacy.

docs.lead_paragraph: A lawyer for a 17-year-old mother charged with throwing her baby into the Passaic River Saturday night said today that she had been forced to leave home two years ago and was recently depressed and suffering from memory lapses. ''I think this is a very troubled young lady,'' the lawyer, Anthony Fusco, said after a brief court hearing on the charge that his client murdered her 16-month-old son. ''What's going on in her mind right now, God only knows. I'm not so sure even she knows why she did this.''

headline.main: Teenage Mother Accused of Throwing Baby in River Was Depressed, Lawyer Says

docs.abstract: Anthony Fusco, lawyer for 17-year-old mother charged with throwing her 16-month-old son into Passaic River in Paterson, NJ, says she was forced to leave home two years ago and was recently depressed and suffering from memory lapses; says he will consider insanity defense if client is charged as an adult (M)
